column4: how much processor power do i really need to run ubuntu without noticing any sluggishness, mostly i want to be able to download with bittorrent and watch movis at the same time, and still be able to check email and browse the web
pahlooka:how much rams do you have
what are your system stats? (RAM & CPU?)
anything reasonably modern will run Ubuntu just fine. More RAM is always good, though :)
what do you consider modern
anything less than 2 years old - my own machine is just a bit over 2yrs old, tech-wise
what is your processor?
I've got an AMD XP-M 2500+, slightly overclocked to about 2.0Ghz
and your happy with the performance?
yes, as I said, ubuntu is faster than XP was on this machine, and actually getting *faster* with each new release of Ubuntu
have you ever maxed out your cpu?
it goes to 100% fairly regularly, never stays there for long - but Gnome itself hardly ever lags
bittorrent doesn't take much processor/ram, really
ouch - I've had up to five or six torrents going here, no problems at all
hmm, not fast, but torrents usually aren't
wow - I never clock anywhere near that high - not sure my broadband actually will do that sort of speed at all :P
if you're just buying a tower (no new monitor, etc) probably no more than $500-600 USD (very roughly)
for that price what would you recommend
I'm not really sure - it's been a year since I bought my system, and a year is a long, long time for computer tech :P
start googling for hardware review sites, and checking places like new egg and other online retailers
no, but most hardware runs Linux just fine - just be careful with things like wireless & printers
benchmarks are benchmarks, and there are also some very good Linux-specific hardware sites - linuxprinting.org, for example
the good review sites - Tom's Hardware, say - give you enough detail to compare things fairly well
